page.title: 08SOCIAL CONCERNS & ATTITUDES
page.content: ECOLOGY AND CONSERVATION. The local population are vey concerned with the poor state of public footpaths, and lack of signs leading to the Offas Dyke path. This is a tourist area, people of many nationalities come to the area and experience much difficulty in this direction. TRANSPORT. Although there is a reasonable bus service in the area, it is very expensive, and here the community spirit is shown, neighbours will give lifts freely to those who do not have their own transport. DISCUSSION. The two pubs are the main meeting places of the local farmers where they discuss the prices of animals sold at the cattle markets, the cost of animal feed, harvest and other topics.
